title: [User Experience]: Users need to press the "esc" key to cancel the link that has been dragged out.
body: ### Frontend Version ### Expected Behavior When a link is dragged out, after the mouse is released, the link should be cancelled as well. ### Actual Behavior Have to press `esc` to cancel the link. This operation has been changed and is very different from previous ones, so some users reported it in the WeChat group. I don't know if it needs to be fixed or not. ### Steps to Reproduce https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/408f5326-61b1-4ff3-8a68-0cdaf0ecf238 ### What browsers do you use to access the UI ? Google Chrome ### Other Information Here is the operation users are used to in the previous version. https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/97d7096f-0c78-41eb-aa4d-cdd76bcf39ff ┆Issue is synchronized with this [Notion page](https://www.notion.so/Issue-3618-User-Experience-Users-need-to-press-the-esc-key-to-cancel-the-link-that-has-been--1e06d73d3650812aabfac51c5e6a055b) by [Unito](https://www.unito.io)

title: [API Nodes] Credit indicators
body:
We would like to inform users about the credit consumption for running API nodes before they click the run button. There are 2 major indicators to implement.

## Run button indicator

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/71b13c73-16e6-4d63-829f-99a4391ab51e)

## Node indicator

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b96f044c-7ead-4643-8d42-f5647db9fab3)

The node indicator is ideally a DOM widget, which will allow style customization with CSS. The node indicator should not serialize its value to the workflow

title: [Feature Request]: Allow horizontal scrolling for Keybinding tab
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [x] I have searched the existing issues and checked the recent builds/commits

### What would your feature do ?

Users will be able to scroll horizontally in the keybinding panel.

### Proposed workflow

1. Go to the keybinding panel
2. Click and drag the horizontal scrollbar
3. View hidden aspects of the keybinding panel if horizontal screen space is limited.

### Additional information

This could also make space for a keybind source column that was mentioned in #1086, and potentially the edit individual keybind button, but there is discussion on whether or not to move that into a context menu.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cf8fdbc4-f4f1-47b7-9070-e3a81bbfb8cb)

title: [Feature Request]: Show refresh button only when the node is using remote widget
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [x] I have searched the existing issues and checked the recent builds/commits

### What would your feature do ?

Currently when all nodes are selected, the refresh button also appears in the selection toolbox, which can be confusing. We just don't know what will be refreshed.

### Proposed workflow

There are 2 alternatives:
- We always show the refresh button, and clicking it refreshes the node definition of the selected nodes
- We remove the refresh node definition feature, and just show it for nodes that use remote widget

### Additional information

Original design PR:
https://github.com/Comfy-Org/ComfyUI_frontend/pull/2612

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ae921c95-6bae-4e28-a84e-a8faaec5440e)

It can be especially confusing when there is just a single node in the workflow
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a3e1359c-c2e4-49ca-82cb-df12a29ea40a)

┆Issue is synchronized with this [Notion page](https://www.notion.so/Issue-3391-Feature-Request-Show-refresh-button-only-when-the-node-is-using-remote-widget-1d16d73d3650812582ecd87b00fef78f) by [Unito](https://www.unito.io)

title: [Feature Request]: Add icon next to locale setting field
body:

- [x] I have searched the existing issues and checked the recent builds/commits

### What would your feature do ?

Currently, you can only navigate to the locale setting using text based indicators/guides:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/26418030-88fa-482a-b46d-64dff97957f8)

This is difficult if you do not know the language the UI is in to begin with.

This feature would add a language-agnostic way to guide user to locale setting, such as a standard icon like:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/97a792a3-030b-410b-b578-fc8ceb3d7d92)

### Proposed workflow

1. Open ComfyUI in langauge you do not know
2. Click settings button
3. Be able to find the locale setting intuitively, despite not knowing the language


### Additional information

_No response_

title: [Feature Request]: Change window-close confirm dialog to only open if there are unsaved workflows
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues and checked the recent builds/commits

### What would your feature do ?

Currently there is a setting called `Comfy.Window.UnloadConfirmation`:

![Selection_756](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2f8712c9-841f-4319-90fc-d3d8646ea9a9)

The confirm dialog opens whenever the user leaves the page, regardless of whether there are any unsaved changes or not. This feature would change the dialog such that it only opens if there are unsaved changes. 

### Proposed workflow

1. Attempt to navigate away from the page or reload
3. Confirm dialog appears only if there are unsaved changes.

### Additional information

This was mentioned in the original PR (https://github.com/Comfy-Org/ComfyUI_frontend/pull/690) where the dialog was implemented:

> On window close, a browser level dialog will be poped up to remind user unsaved changes. The browser message cannot be customized due to security reasons enforced by browser vendors.
> 
> The default setting value is false. Later after the workflow manager redesign, we should have the dialog popup based whether there is unsaved content. Currently the dialog just always trigger on close based on the setting value.


┆Issue is synchronized with this [Notion page](https://www.notion.so/Issue-2254-Feature-Request-Change-window-close-confirm-dialog-to-only-open-if-there-are-unsave-17c6d73d3650813baf4bee4ac2de30eb) by [Unito](https://www.unito.io)

title: [Feature Request]: Node search and filters dialog auto-focus
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues and checked the recent builds/commits

### What would your feature do ?

The node search dialog box currently is only ever auto-focused on initially being opened (with no filters). When selecting a filter, or after applying a filter, I have to first click on the input area to allow for searching again. These should be auto-focused.

### Proposed workflow

1. Open the node search dialog
2. Click on the filter button
3. Select a filter category
4. Click filter dropdown
5. **Search box for filter category's dropdown should be auto-focused**
6. Pick filter
7. Click `Add`
8. **Search box for node search should be auto-focused**
9. Pick node

### Additional information

These are the two types of search boxes being referred to that are not auto-focused:

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ad03e30b-fd47-49c9-a81e-a3e24b1a68db)
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/af92acfd-5a81-4de3-95f6-0445040e51a9)

┆Issue is synchronized with this [Notion page](https://www.notion.so/Issue-1993-Feature-Request-Node-search-and-filters-dialog-auto-focus-1616d73d3650816aa585ef8e4282fbb2) by [Unito](https://www.unito.io)

title: [Feature Request]: [ Aesthetics  ] Match the "small" Sidebar to the Topbar dimensions
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues and checked the recent builds/commits

### What would your feature do ?

The "normal" Sidebar, it's to wide for me. 
I like the "small" Sidebar, but it's a bit too narrow.

I have a 27 inch, FHD monitor ( 1920 x 1080 )
The narrow sidebar has a 40 pixel width.
But the Top Bar it's 44 pixels high.

If we make the "small" Sidebar 44 pixels wide, it would look better and be more usable. 

I think "small" Sidebar had the same dimensions of the Topbar, when it was introduced. 
But then the Topbar got a little taller. I think it was because of the workflow tabs. 

---


**Small SideBar** ( current )

![z01](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3e7594d7-75ab-4e5b-a333-caa5d1d7464b)

**Mockup** ( same width as Topbar )

![z02](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f17bb91b-5ae7-4eee-bd0f-9873b3f095d6)


----

The "normal" Sidebar it's 64 pixels wide, so there is still plenty of difference between both options.

**Normal Sidebar:**

![z03](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/019cc718-a673-4e7a-a1f5-fd16f4c34fa0)



### Proposed workflow

.

### Additional information

_No response_

┆Issue is synchronized with this [Notion page](https://www.notion.so/Issue-1992-Feature-Request-Aesthetics-Match-the-small-Sidebar-to-the-Topbar-dimensions-1616d73d3650815a801bc6a81591fdf0) by [Unito](https://www.unito.io)

title: [Feature Request]: Displaying images from cancelled workflow in the history
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues and checked the recent builds/commits

### What would your feature do ?

I wish instead of showing a blank slate for cancelled workflows, it showed the last generated pic in that workflow.

For example, I have Ksampler -> preview -> Ksampler -> preview -> facedetailer -> preview. If I cancel before the facedetailer, I'd want to see that image instead of a blank box in the queue. It would be the most recent image in temp.

Currently, it only shows a blank slate.

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fe6c7811-99b5-4ecd-bb25-1d9135bbdb11)

### Proposed workflow

For example, I have Ksampler -> preview -> Ksampler -> preview -> facedetailer -> preview. If I cancel before the facedetailer, I'd want to see that image instead of a blank box in the queue. It would be the most recent image in temp.

### Additional information

_No response_

body:

- [X] I have searched the existing issues and checked the recent builds/commits

### What would your feature do ?

The current functionality of navigating and focusing on selected nodes in Comfy UI could be enhanced by implementing a feature that allows users to focus on a selected node(s) using the 'F' key. This would improve accessibility

### Proposed workflow

1. Go to workflow panel

![Step1](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ef3173b4-3fef-4eef-8a15-92f169ee5aa1)

4. The graph will zoom in to the selected node(s)

But I would like to set other new keybinds that would also improve user experience:

title: [Feature Request]: Set option `Top bar menu options`
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues and checked the recent builds/commits

### What would your feature do ?

There have been complaints about floating menu options.
https://github.com/Comfy-Org/ComfyUI_frontend/pull/726#issuecomment-2375878063 https://github.com/Comfy-Org/ComfyUI_frontend/pull/933#issuecomment-2376486703

Float panels will encroach on the editable area of ​​the canvas, including the `float menu options`, which greatly affects the workflow editing/using experience.
The top bar menu option should not be removed, it should be kept as one of the settings options.

The feature `Opened workflows tabs` is great! So it would be better if the top bar is only used for `Opened workflows tabs` and `menu options`.

> ~~For custom plugins, a separate sidebar should be added to place buttons for custom plugins.~~
> ~~Instead of letting them abuse float panels or take up valuable space in the top bar.~~

Suddenly I realized that this is a difficult problem to solve. The top bar and side bar of the new front end can be used to place buttons for custom plug-ins, but the author of the custom plug-in still has to add floating buttons that occupy the canvas.

The impact of float panels on workflow editing/use:
(I cannot edit the nodes in the red box directly. I have to move the canvas first before I can edit them.)
![float_raw](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9d044039-a216-4a9a-995e-27bce79b8f46)

Changes to editable areas:
![nofloat](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6ecab8cc-80a9-4eae-a08e-244b7b9579ff)
![float](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/75d55d1f-f540-46ac-9edf-0b7424b11301)


### Proposed workflow

1. Go to ....
2. Press ....
3. ...


### Additional information

_No response_

title: [Feature Request]: Drag a model into an existing node, from the Model Library.
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues and checked the recent builds/commits

### What would your feature do ?

When we drag a model into the canvas, a new node is created. 
This is very useful to build new workflows. 

But I'd like to load the model into an existing node, if the model is dragged into that node.
Currently, a new node is created.

![lib](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f34d3d2d-a5bd-4be5-be27-461b7e065e84)



### Proposed workflow

Just drag the model on top of a compatible loader node. 

You could add a visual indicator ( while clicking down ), to make sure the model will be loaded on the existing node ( on click up ).
( It could be, for example, a blue line around the node ).

---

If the current workflow only has a loader node for the selected model, this could also be done via right click menu.
It could be similar to the workflow right click menu, but just with the insert option. 

( This may be too complex to implement but, ideally, the right click menu could list all the loader nodes, in the current workflow, that would accept the model. )

![libw](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a89c34bb-54fc-4377-98a4-c79494f5cdbb)


### Additional information

_No response_

title: [Feature Request]: groups inside groups should be dragged
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues and checked the recent builds/commits

### What would your feature do ?

If I drag a group, all the nodes in it move with it. But if there is another group within in, the internal group doesn't move.

That makes it hard to have nested groups (which is useful for using the group bypass), because when you move the main group, the subgrouping gets broken.

Could be considered with #645 (but not the same issue)

### Proposed workflow

When a group is dragged, not only are all nodes that are part of that group moved with it, but all groups that overlap with it.

Example:
![Screenshot 2024-09-18 124137](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/dd8a1fd4-ea07-40e5-a591-30cda820f21d)

Current behaviour, if I drag the outer group down, is:
![Screenshot 2024-09-18 124146](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/59b7c474-c8ac-46b1-bce4-bf44caf10070)

Ideally it would be this:
![Screenshot 2024-09-18 124250](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/37bb005f-a8cc-4239-a067-34933a0053c6)



### Additional information

_No response_

title: Pin node library searchbox at top
body: ![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d2fefb34-9e79-4d1b-b536-8f30829dc823)

title: [Feature Request]: Add Language Setting
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this? - [X] I have searched the existing issues and checked the recent builds/commits ### What would your feature do ? Expose language settings... ### Proposed workflow Currently, the language is [auto-detected](https://github.com/Comfy-Org/ComfyUI_frontend/issues/442#issuecomment-2291702107). Instead, make it a dropdown or something... ### Additional information At the very least, don't show simplified chinese when my system is in traditional chinese...

Yes, I know like 90% of the games do this, especially when they don't have `zh-TW` option. But at least I could change back to English in the settings...

title: [Feature Request]: Adding Favorite nodes in Node Library
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues and checked the recent builds/commits

### What would your feature do ?

In [ComfyUI-N-Sidebar](https://github.com/Nuked88/ComfyUI-N-Sidebar) there is an option to pin favorite nodes so you can easy access your most used nodes.

Is it possible to implement this useful feature to Node Library?

![ComfyUI-N-Sidebar_Favorite_option](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/48009241-48ba-4785-b81c-4ba3fd0c5ba5)

### Proposed workflow

1. Open Node Library tab.

2. Next to each node there is a ❤️ icon you can click. (recommended)
Alternatively, there is a favorite option when you right-click on node.

3. The node is added to Favorites, a fixed section at the top of Node Library. (similar to N-Sidebar)
Alternatively, to keep Node Library clean, there is a new tab in the sidebar called "Favorite Nodes". (recommended)


### Additional information

_No response_

title: [Feature Request]: Show intermediate images on workflows that are running
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues and checked the recent builds/commits

### What would your feature do ?

Load this simple workflow
![ComfyUI_01070_](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/38f314cf-5629-4f3c-b86a-78e444caa66c)

I took a screenshot while KSampler is running, it would be nice if that preview would be shown instead of the spinning black box
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d764593c-703c-475f-b4a4-5b53db042d04)

### Proposed workflow

While workflow is running the latest generated image should show instead this empty box with a spinner
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/08910366-1768-4854-8568-196a5c09287f)

### Additional information

When adding prompts via the API you get no feedback at all so this would make it more possible to check on the current progress of an API-added workflow.

title: [Feature Request]: Suggestions for setting the display size of node lists
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues and checked the recent builds/commits

### What would your feature do ?

Regarding the settings here, can two items be added to adjust the font size and line spacing of the plugin name and node name in the new node list?
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/134d8bbc-9823-4e84-baa2-8be31e59e435)
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/435478e7-1930-48bd-8ddf-599a1bc6bef5)


### Proposed workflow

For example, after adjusting the font size and line spacing in the settings (it is recommended that the font size range is  6  ~  32 pixel, and the spacing range is  -2  ~  16 pixel).
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/235c97bc-5b49-4eb9-bad5-dbb8369204de)
The font and spacing in this list will become similar to the ones on the left.  


### Additional information

Adjustment reason: Because there are too many plugins in ComfyUI. For example, when creating a new node in the right-click menu, the font is set very small to display more. However, for the current new list, although it is more convenient to find nodes, the font and spacing have become larger. If there are many search results, it will take a long time to scroll the mouse. Adding this setting can facilitate everyone to adjust it according to their own preferences.

title: [Feature Request]: Show node class name on search bar
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

### What would your feature do ?

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8194f387-fe4b-476e-a741-322c5c228e83)

Previously, I coud see node class name (or name for connecting?) on search bar,
and it is so easy to find node.

new UI also can search using class name, but doesn't show the name.

### Proposed workflow

1. double click the graph screen
2. input "unet" on search bar
3. "UNETLoader" shown around "Load diffusion model". "UNET" part should be highlighted.

### Additional information

_No response_

title: [Feature Request]: Node List for Drag-Popup too Shallow
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues and checked the recent builds/commits

### What would your feature do ?

The old context menu when pulling off an output would give a variable list (is a setting in ComfyUI) -- The new only presents the current filter box that has a large amount of wasted space, in addition to not being adjustable (size).

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/13045bde-d5b5-4076-a47b-75045f83964e)


Adjusting the CSS, or exposing settings to shrink this list are welcome. I do not think you need the separation now that you have removed descriptions.

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/af2affe5-959a-4e31-84e1-3e878ddb99a8)



### Proposed workflow

1. pull off output pin
2. get condensed, custom settings sized list panel
3. work faster.


### Additional information

_No response_

title: [Feature Request]: Improve the text formatting in nodes and settings.
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues and checked the recent builds/commits

### What would your feature do ?

At the moment, ComfyUI's nodes and settings lack appropriate text formatting. There isn't even any space between the words in the new setting daialog. Please provide proper text formatting for nodes and settings in the new frontend to make UI easy to use and understand, like SwarmUI has done with samplers.
